nodes.title: Description
nodes.body: Rituals designed to bring about prosperity, by relying on deities like Vaiśravaṇa (rnam sras), Kubera (nor sbyin, dpal sbyin), Jambhala (gnod gnas), White Tāra (sgrol dkar), Vasudhārā (nor rgyun ma), Yamarāja, and the eight Wealth Gods (nor lha brgyad).

nodes.title: Secondary Sources
nodes.body:
Brounský, D. "Prosperity in a Whirlpool of Symbolic Contexts: Some Notes on Tibetan G.Yang 'Gugs and Buryat Dalga Rituals." In Mongolica Pragensia '04: Ethnolinguistics and Sociolinguistics in Synchrony and Diachrony, edited by Jaroslav Vacek and Alena Oberfalzerová. Prague: Triton and Charles University, Philosophical Faculty, Institute of South and Central Asian Studies, Seminar of Mongolian Studies, 2004.

Norbu, Namkhai. "The Bön of the Cha: The Rites for Prosperity." In Drung, Deu and Bön: Narrations, Symbolic Languages and the Bön Tradition in Ancient Tibet, 63-76. Dharamsala: Library of Tibetan Works and Archives, 1995.
